10029.description: DREAM, an award winning youth development program, is seeking volunteer tutors to provide academic support to our middle school after-school students in East Harlem and the South Bronx. Tutors work with youth individually and in small groups to help improve student success in class, increase subject-specific retention, and contribute to overall academic enrichment and development. What You’ll Do Support academic enrichment activities, including homework help and tutoring; Provide individualized and team-wide support all after-school program activities and initiatives; Serve as a role model and build positive relationships with youth; What We’re Looking For Strong command of one or more of the following academic subjects: English, Math, Science, and/or Social Studies Previous experience working with youth; Possess creativity, enthusiasm, initative, flexibility, and patience; Solid oral communication skills; Ability to make a consistent, weekly commitment; Bachelor’s Degree (a plus); 1-2 years previous tutoring experience (a major plus). Benefits Gain invaluable experience and opportunities for professional development at an award winning youth development program; Receive an optional professional reference upon completion of your service term; Join an incredible community of passionate staff and volunteers. Minimum Commitment: 1-2 hours per week for 3 months. When: Monday - Thursday 4pm-5pm, 4pm-6pm, or 5:30pm-6:30pm (time depends on tutor availability and program site assignment) DREAM provides equal opportunity for all volunteers.
10029.title: Volunteer Tutor

10029.description: You can empower a child to believe in themselves, and fulfill their potential! Mentoring is rewarding - Become a mentor with Mentoring USA. LoCation: St Ann’s School 314 East 110th Street New York, Ny 10029 times: every other Wednesday from 6:00 PM - 7:30 PM. Populations: students between ages 9-13 Mentors needed: 3 Mentoring USA's mission is to create sustained and supportive mentor relationships for underserved youth ages 7-21. Mentoring USA partners with schools, community centers, foster care agencies, and other non-profits. Mentors are matched with youth. With trained adult mentors who can guide in developing better self-esteem, creating healthy relationships, and making positive life choices, our underserved youth have the opportunity to grow up healthier. Mentors and mentees meet in a supervised environment at a set time and location. All sites are supported by MUSA Program Managers who work directly with Site Supervisors at each location to ensure that the programs run smoothly. Contact: volunteering@mentoringusa.org All mentors must be 18 and older and willing to undergo a background check and screening. Step 1: Visit Mentoring USA's website: http://www.mentoringusa.org Step 2: Complete the Mentor Application: http://www.mentoringusa.org/become_a_mentor/Mentor_Application Step 3: Attend our New Mentor Training.
10029.title: Mentoring is rewarding - Become a mentor with Mentoring USA – East Harlem.

10029.description: The Carter Burden Network, a nonprofit leader in aging services in New York City, is looking for a bright, energetic Development and Special Events Intern to join our Development team. This opportunity is great for someone who is interested in learning the ins and outs of the nonprofit sector while building skills and adding valuable work experience to their resume. This internship will provide training in DonorPerfect, one of the top CRM (customer relationship management) softwares used by nonprofits. Responsibilities: Assist with daily office tasks including data/gift entry and donor management (DonorPerfect - training provided), preparing and mailing thank you letters to donors, proofreading, preparing meeting documents etc. Assist with planning and executing special events and projects including the 2017 Gala on November 15th, 2017 Assist with planning and executing end-of-year fundraising appeals such as Giving Tuesday (November) and the Annual Appeal (November/December) Provide marketing and light social media support Qualifications: Bachelor's or Master's Level applicants only (degree-holding or currently enrolled) Proficient in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Publisher, PowerPoint) Excellent communication, organizational, and time-management skills Detail-oriented (have an eagle eye for typos!) Interest in working in the nonprofit sector or aging services a plus Additional Information 10-15 hours a week, 2-3 days a week (with flexibility) 3-4 months starting in November Travel stipend available (Metrocard) Our office is located on 109th Street in East Harlem To apply, please email your resume and cover letter to Kerry at mcdonaldk@carterburdennetwork.org
10029.title: Fall 2017/Early Winter 2018 Development and Events Internship

10029.description: We need a Volunteer Photographer to do photography work at our non profit organization. We need good quality photography of our programs, to help tell our clients' stories. Perfect for a photography student who wants to explore their photography skills, and great for someone who wants to offer their expert photography skills to a non profit organization that relies on telling the important stories of the most vulnerable New Yorkers. Flexibly schedule; 2 - 4 hours a week. Please email tgough@lsafhs.org with your resume.
10029.title: URGENT! Volunteer Photographer Needed!

10029.description: Reading Partners needs volunteers like you to provide students in under-resourced elementary schools in your community with the proven, individualized reading support they need to read at grade level by fourth grade. Reading is the foundation for all future learning.The ability to read transforms lives and can empower children to reach their full potential. Research shows that when students can read at grade level by fourth grade, they have a greater opportunity to succeed in school and in life. With your help, we can equip students with the foundational skills they need to read at grade level. Each week, you will meet one-on-one with your student every week to help them develop strong literacy skills and discover a passion for reading. We'll provide a structured curriculum, in-person training, and ongoing support to help your student thrive. Rigorous research has proven that Reading Partners significantly increases reading proficiency. No teaching experience required and anyone over the age of 14 can volunteer. Flexible Monday to Thursday volunteer times between 9am and 5pm. Visit our website at www.readingpartners.org/volunteer to sign up and learn more.
10029.title: Become a reading partner- make a lifelong impact on a child (PS 38 Roberto Clemente, NYC)

10029.description: We are looking for aspiring or qualified ESL teachers to work with our wonderful non-profit organization. We teach immigrant women on Fridays and Saturdays at a Community School in East Harlem. The school has donated the space for us, and many of the women are parents of their students. The majority of the students are literacy level. They are learning their ABCs and slowly learn vocabulary and very simple sentences. Others are more advanced and can discuss situations and issues. Non training is necessary, as we will happily give support and training throughout. You must have a genuine desire to help immigrants thrive in their new country. We are looking to add teachers to our rotation schedule for two mornings a month. Class times are 9:30-11:30 Friday and Saturday. There is no compensation, we are all 100% volunteers at our organization, but we are a fun group, enjoy our work and are building a real community group.
10029.title: ESL Assistant

10029.description: Help pack groceries for low income seniors at our office in Manhattan on 8 East 109th street. This project occurs every Monday from 10am-2pm. To sign up, please visit our website calendar here: http://nycommonpantry.org/how-to-help/volunteer/
10029.title: Help Pack Groceries for Low Income Seniors (Manhattan)

10029.description: Opus 118 Harlem School of Music is searching for qualified board member candidates for the 2017-2018 year. We are seeking a group of diverse and dynamic volunteers for our growing organization who are passionate about our mission of providing access to quality music education to the students of East Harlem, New York. Opus 118 Harlem School of Music ( www.Opus118.org ) provides high-quality music instruction in an environment that nurtures excellence and creativity. Students in the East Harlem community are served with tuition-free twice-weekly group violin instruction during regular school hours and subsidized private instruction for violin, viola, cello, guitar, and piano after school hours. This organization was founded by the now-legendary Roberta Guaspari, whose fight for in-school music programs in East Harlem became the subject of a documentary ( Small Wonders) and a feature film (Music from the Heart). Roberta continues to work in East Harlem Schools while actively training the next generation of teachers for Opus 118. We are looking for people who are: excited about our mission to provide access to quality music education for East Harlem children available for quarterly meetings in-person and other outside Opus 118 events connected and personable capable of fundraising and helping our organization grow financially skilled in areas such as fundraising, marketing, finance, networking, budgeting, legal for non-profits, and/ or music committed to donating financially annually Interested applicants should email Hayley Collins at hcollins@opus118.org .
10029.title: Volunteer Board Member

10029.description: Harlem RBI, an award winning youth development program, is seeking volunteer coaches to work with youth between the ages of 11-18 in practices and games. Coaches teach baseball/softball and provide youth with opportunities to play, learn, and grow, inspiring them to recognize their potential and realize their dreams. Each coach serves as a member of a team made up of coaches and managers. Harlem RBI volunteer coaches can have a direct and meaningful impact on the positive development of the youth they coach. The ideal candidate is passionate about youth development, has played and/or coached baseball/softball, and is an effective communicator. Roles and Responsibilities * Coach youth in technical skills, teambuilding and personal development; * Lead practices, facilitate team meetings and attend professional development trainings; * Provide a positive, team-based environment focused on teaching baseball, softball and life skills; * Attend 1 weeknight practice and 1 weekend game each week during the season. Qualifications * Passionate about youth development; * Understanding of the power of teamwork; * Ability to create a positive, team-based environment focused on teaching baseball/softball; * Organizational skills, energy and flexibility; * Solid oral communication skills; * Ability to commit to the coaching position for at least one full season; * Baseball/Softball playing or coaching experience for ages 13 and up; * Experience with inner-city coaching (a plus); * At least 18 years of age. Hours Time commitment varies by age group but is generally 4-8 hours/week. Practices (weeknights) typically last 1.5 hours and games (weekends) last between 2-5 hours. The coaching staff of a Harlem RBI team consists of up to five adult volunteers: a manager and four coaches.
10029.title: Volunteer Baseball and Softball Coach

10029.description: The Carter Burden Network is dedicated to supporting the efforts of older people to remain in their homes living independently, safely, and with dignity. Volunteers are an integral component of the Carter Burden Network's 40+ years of success. No matter your age, experience or schedule, CBN can accommodate your needs to ensure that you have a meaningful and effective volunteer experience. The Friendly Visiting program matches volunteers with seniors who share common interests and hobbies for social interaction. Volunteers participate in visits at least twice a month (for 1-2 hours) in a senior's home and may chat, play a game, read a book, take a walk (if the senior is able), or another activity. The Friendly Visiting program is an on-going opportunity. We are looking for compassionate, patient, and committed volunteers comfortable engaging with seniors having memory issues. Time is flexible but we are looking for volunteers available on weekdays (in the afternoons) or weekends. If you are interested in this opportunity please email us at: volunteer@carterburdennetwork.org
10029.title: Become a friendly visitor!

10029.description: Friendly Visiting is a program that pairs volunteers with homebound seniors to provide company and friendship. We ask volunteers to commit to visit their senior match one time per week for a period of six months or more. We are seeking volunteers to visit seniors who live between 96th and 145th street on the east side of Manhattan. Spanish speakers encouraged to apply! If you are interested in learning more about this opportunity, please reply with your phone number and the best time to reach you to discuss further. Thank you!
10029.title: Friendly Visiting- East Harlem

10029.description: URGENT! We need Classroom Aide Volunteers for our Early Childhood Socialization groups, starting September 18th. Volunteer aides help support the mom/toddler interaction in a cheerful, interactive classroom setting. We have approximately 10 - 15 moms/toddlers (15 months - 3 years of age) per class. Focus of the program is supporting the development and socialization needs of the child, and support the bonding between parent and child, so that the child can achieve the milestones for development. Includes art and music activities as well as free play in the classroom to support the learning needs of the child and fosters bonding between parent and child. Hours needed: 2 sessions a day available between Monday and Thursdays. Ideally a volunteer will commit to two days a week: Mondays and Wednesdays, 9:30 - 11:30 and 12:30 - 2:30 or Tuesdays and Thursdays from 9:30 - 11:30 and 12:30 - 2:30 pm. Bilingual (English and Spanish) helpful, but not necessary. Must enjoy interacting with toddlers, and have an interest in early childhood development.
10029.title: URGENT! We need Classrooms Aides for our Early Childhood Socialization Program

10029.description: Are you a piano player who would like to play on our beautiful baby grand piano in the hospital lobby? We are looking for volunteers to play every day, once a week, or once a month (Monday - Friday between 9AM and 6PM). It is a wonderful experience, between a practice room and a concert hall! The music will be enjoyed by patients, families, visitors and staff members, and you will bring joy to the environment. A prerequisite is a one-time audition.
10029.title: Hospital Piano Player

10029.description: The Carter Burden Network is dedicated to supporting the efforts of older people to remain in their homes living independently, safely, and with dignity. Volunteers are an integral component of the Carter Burden Network's 40+ years of success. No matter your age, experience or schedule, CBN can accommodate your needs to ensure that you have a meaningful and effective volunteer experience. Everyday seniors gather to socialize and enjoy a hot meal at the Carter Burden Leonard/Covello Senior Program in East Harlem. The Carter Burden Network prides itself on serving restaurant-style meals made in our own kitchens and served on-site to our participants. Volunteers work both in the kitchen and dining room in food preparation, meal distribution, and cleaning capacities. Volunteer hours are from 10:30am to 1:00pm. Groups no larger than 5, please
10029.title: Meal Service - small groups welcome

10029.description: Go the extra mile with Back on My Feet NYC's Team Bowery North! Dedicated teams of volunteers run 2-4 miles with our members who are transitioning out of homelessness. We encourage runners of all speeds to become a part of our community! Team Bowery North meets at 315 E 115th St. every Monday, Wednesday, and Friday from 5:45-6:45AM. To find out more and sign up for an orientation, visit nyc.backonmyfeet.org/nyc-run-with-us
10029.title: East Harlem Morning Runner

10029.description: East Harlem Tutorial Program offers a variety of volunteer opportunities through our charter schools and after-school programs, ranging from subject-matter tutoring, providing students with homework help, mentoring, and preparing high school students for college success. Volunteers work with our scholars, preparing them for academic success, supporting their social enrichment, and helping them gain the confidence they will need to succeed in college and in life. Check out our volunteer options below: Find more info here: https://ehtp.org/volunteer Apply here: http://bttr.im/ubhw2 Volunteer Opportunities Classroom Buddies - Volunteers work in one of our Kindergarten through 5th Grade after-school classes assisting our scholars with homework, walking them through engaging classroom activities, and supporting our Assistant and Lead Teachers. Commitment: At least twice a week When: Monday through Thursday, 4pm - 6pm Elementary Homework Help - Volunteers support our young scholars as they tackle tough homework while building supportive relationships and positively impacting their academic achievement. In small groups, volunteers address the individual needs of our scholars and focus on content they are learning during the week. Commitment: Once a week When: Saturdays, 10am - 11:30am Scholars Friday Clubs -Volunteers engage in fun clubs geared toward getting our scholars active and expressing themselves creatively! Volunteers can choose clubs such as dance club, theater/drama club, music/percussion, capoeira (Brazilian martial arts), and soccer. No experience needed -- just a can do attitude! Commitment: Once a week When: Fridays, 1pm - 4pm Road to Success - Middle School is some of the most formative years for East Harlem’s young people. These years will determine which high school they get into and ultimately whether they go to college. Road to Success provides a small group setting where scholars receive homework help from volunteers interested in making a difference in the lives of young people. Commitment: At least once a week When: Monday through Thursday, 5pm - 6pm University Tutoring - Volunteers help our middle and high school scholars succeed in various subjects (Math, English, Science, History), while in a one-on-one setting. Volunteers should feel confident tutoring and demonstrate success in a 6th - 12th grade level subject. Commitment: Once a week When: Monday and Wednesday, 6:30pm - 8pm College Mentoring Program - The College Mentoring Program is a one-on-one mentoring project that aims to guide high school students through the entire college application process. The program’s goal is to ensure that each senior successfully applies to college, finds financial aid, and chooses the school that is best suited for their needs. The Program is a two year commitment for both the mentor and mentee, with weekly requirements in the first year and monthly requirements in the second year. Commitment: Once a week When: Tuesday and Wednesday, 6:30pm - 8pm
10029.title: Do you love working with young people? Volunteer at East Harlem Tutorial Program!

10029.description: We have an urgent need for after school Home Work Help volunteers to assist school aged East Harlem children in our after school Home Work Help program. You can volunteer on either Tuesdays from 4:30 - 6 pm or Thursdays from 4:30 - 6 pm. We have a group of 25 children who receive tutoring twice a week and who come twice a week with their homework. You might assist one child during the entire session or additional children as may be needed. The children in this program are children who cannot always receive help from their parents with their homework; and so this program is very important for their school success. You can do one or both sessions a week. Please contact the Volunteer Director at tgough@lsafhs.org Thank you for your consideration!
10029.title: URGENT!  Home Work Help Volunteers Needed!

10029.description: As we are currently facing very difficult budget cuts in New York State, our Food Pantry which serves East Harlem children and families is experiencing a dramatic reduction of donations. Our shelves are barely stocked. If you work for an organization that might be interested in hosting a Food Drive, please be in touch (646) 672-0434. Canned food, dry goods, and other practical foodstuffs are most needed. We can pick up at any site in New York City. Thank you for remembering our most vulnerable New Yorkers!!
10029.title: Can Your Organization host a Food Drive for our Food Pantry?

10029.description: STARTING IN OCTOBER 2017: Help us help the neediest students in New York City! ! We need caring, committed after school Tutors for our After School Tutoring Program for children in K - 3. Times needed: MONDAYS AND WEDNESDAYS FROM 3:30 - 4:30. Tutors ideally commit to two days a week as you would tutor the same child twice a week. You will tutor one-on-one a child in grades K- 3 who struggles with reading and writing at grade level. Most of the children are children of immigrants and English is not spoken at home, so they struggle with English reading and writing at school. Tutoring begins mid October and continues through the spring sememster (until June 2018). Please help an East Harlem child! Tutoring makes all the difference for our children -- the difference between success and failure in school. If you would like to volunteer, please email an inquiry email with your resume to tgough@lsafhs.org
10029.title: URGENT!!  We Need Tutors to Tutor East Harlem Children Mondays and Wednesdays!

10029.description: The Ambassador Volunteer Program welcomes patients, families and visitors as they enter the Hospital and escorts them to their destination. The hours are Monday -Friday from 8AM - 5:00 PM. Mount Sinai is large and there are 12 buildings most of which are connected by a main corridor (underground) level. The Ambassadors help patients, families, and visitors figure out where they have to go (through Ipad technology and skills we teach them) and then escort them there. We ask Ambassadors to serve at least one 3-4 hour session per week. We have an orientation and then pair new Ambassadors up with an experienced Ambassador. It is an excellent opportunity to improve your communication skills, learn what it is like to be part of a large healthcare organization, find out how gratifying it is to help others, and become a more active person. If you are kind, compassionate, willing to walk throughout the Hospital, and like to help people we can teach you to be an Ambassador!
10029.title: Mount Sinai Volunteer Ambassador

10029.description: Do you work for a company that wants to assist underpriviliged children in New York City? Help us give healthy sancks to children in our Summer Reading and Math Academy: https://yougivegoods.com/lsa-healthysnackdrive Othere ways your company can help: 1) Your company can host a Toy or Book Drive for children in our programs. We are always in need for educational toys and books for children ages 0 - 12. (we can pick up donations as needed). Our Holiday Program for Families is always in need of new clothing/toys/books for children, especially as gifts for the holidays. 2) Your company can host a Party for children at your office - a great \"team building\" activity for your company and a great way for our children to enjoy an outing and interaction with caring adults. Activities typically include an activity, i.e. art or craft making, and treats (food/snacks). Activity can also be at a local restaurant, or an educational or cultural venue. 3) Your company can work with children at our center for a \"team building\" activity - for example, a 1.5 hour arts and crafts activity or outdoor sports activity are just a couple of ways your group can connect with East Harlem children in our programs. Contact the Volunteer Director for more information. 3) Your company can sponsor a summer trip for our children (to NY state parks, beaches, the Bronx zoo, etc.). For more information about how your company can participate in an activity with our East Harlem children, please contact the Volunteer Director at LSA Family Health Service (646) 672-0434 or email at tgough@lsafhs.org.
10029.title: Corporate Sponsorship Needed! Please Support our Summer Program's Healthy Snack Drive!

10029.description: We need an Advocate for our Advocacy/Emergency Services program. Position requires a commitment for at least two full days, between Monday thru Friday 9 am - 5 pm. Advocate meets one-one one with clients by appointment, conducting intakes, assessing the client's needs, distributing food from the food pantry, and making referrals for necessary services. Duties also includes preparing food packages and stocking and maintaining the food pantry; educating clients regarding government benefits and entitlements; representing clients and advocating on their behalf at the city welfare center or at state hearings; making referrals for child care, counseling, legal assistance, job training, etc. Assist clients to identify and address underlying problems that bring families to the Adovcacy office. Training provided; a six month minimum commitment required. For more information, please contact the Volunteer Director at (646) 672-0434 or email tgough@lsafhs.org.
10029.title: URGENT!  Volunteer Advocate Needed for our Advocacy/Emergency Services Program

10029.description: If you like thrift shops, you'll love the Sharing Place thrift shop. The Sharing Place offers high quality goods at very low prices for members of the East Harlem community. We need help in sorting and pricing clothes, helping customers, helping to decorate/set up store. We also need a volunteer who can assist with administrative tasks; i.e. help with thank you letters to donors, or helping to organize special store sales for the community.
10029.title: Thrift Shop Helpers Needed!

10026.description: Each Wednesday, we prep & serve a simple vegetarian meal offering in Central Harlem for anyone who needs a meal. One can help cook and/or serve and/or clean up. Time commitment is flexible: 2 & 1/2 hours to prep/cook, 1 hour to set up/serve, 1 hour clean up. One can help out with any part of the meal. Any level of skill is accepted.
10026.title: Volunteer To Cook & Serve Every Wednesday

10026.description: Come enliven the intellect and spirit of the youngest of curious learners who are ages 3, 4, or 5! In our program, you will work with a Teacher to support the teacher in her classroom instruction. You will have the opportunity to practice your craft of becoming an early childhood instructor. Lessons that will be facilitated will concentrate in the areas of Science, Engineering, Robotics, and Art. Literacy and Math circle times will also be incorporated. Though your coursework may not concentrate in the area, as many early childhood programs do not, that's ok. Your study or experience in early childhood education is welcomed. If you are student of Education, you are welcome to develop lesson plans that center around a specific topic in your coursework, as well as video that lesson and obtain feedback from the Teacher of record. If you are an early childhood teacher, and you are in transition or are retired, you are welcome to contribute your mastery in our space. Thank you in advance!
10026.title: Calling Early Childhood Student Teachers! We're Looking For STEM PreK Instructors

10026.description: We are looking for a volunteer tutor who can work with one of our clients who is currently enrolled in EMT (Emergency Medical Training) courses. The tutor should be experienced in EMT course material, currently enrolled in an EMT program, graduated from an EMT program, or working in the field. Availability: weekdays (Monday - Friday, any time between 9am and 5pm); weekends would require the tutor to meet offsite with the client.
10026.title: EMT Tutor

10026.description: GiGi’s Playhouse NYC is the only community and education center specifically dedicated to celebrate and support individuals with Down syndrome and their families in New York City. All our programs are designed to empower individuals with Down syndrome to be their own best advocates. All of our amazing programs are delivered by volunteers, and free to participants. We are looking for a social media/marketing intern to support our development of awareness, promotional and marketing materials. Join our team, show the world the value and achievements of people with Down syndrome! Job Title: Social Media/Marketing Intern Flexible Schedule, 8-12 Hours per week Duration: Through Fall Semester, 2017. Additional opportunities for Spring Semester 2018. Wage: Volunteer, possible stipend and course credit Reports to Executive Director Job Tasks and Responsibilities Social Media * Content creation for social media platforms to promote programs and events as well as push awareness and community growth. * Work with Marketing Committee to develop and deliver social media campaigns Marketing * Design weekly newsletters for digital and hard copy distribution * Flyer design and outreach around programs and events. * Attend weekly Marketing Committee calls Development * Work with Executive Director to deliver Giving Tuesday and other online giving campaigns Required Skills * Microsoft Office: Word, Powerpoint * Social Media: Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Wordpress * Media: Photo and video production * Salesforce, Marketing Cloud and other Platforms taught as necessary
10026.title: Down Syndrome Achievement Center Seeking Social Media Volunteers
10026.org: GiGi's Playhouse, Down Syndrome Awareness Centers

10026.description: GiGi’s Playhouse NYC is the only community and education center specifically dedicated to celebrate and support individuals with Down syndrome and their families in New York City. All our programs are designed to empower individuals with Down syndrome to be their own best advocates. All of our amazing programs are delivered by volunteers, and free to participants. We are looking for a media intern to support our development of awareness, promotional and marketing materials. Join our volunteer team and make a difference for the New York City Down syndrome community! Job Title: Media Intern Flexible Schedule, 8-12 Hours per week Duration: Spring Semester 2017. Additional opportunities over Summer Wage: Volunteer, possible stipend and course credit Reports to: Operations Coordinator Job Tasks and Responsibilities Social Media * Visual content creation for social media platforms to promote programs and events as well as push awareness and community growth. Multimedia Projects * Review and organize current and legacy photos, selecting the best for future use. * Assist with video projects. Filming, editing, and distributing. * Tracking of Media Release Forms Marketing * Participate in weekly Marketing Committee calls * Collaborates with Social Media/Marketing Intern and Marketing Team, providing media content for external communication Required Skills * Microsoft Office: Word, Powerpoint * Social Media: Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Wordpress * Media: Photo and video production * Salesforce, Marketing Cloud and other Platforms taught as necessary
10026.title: Down Syndrome Achievement Center Seeking Media Volunteers
10026.org: GiGi's Playhouse, Down Syndrome Awareness Centers

10026.description: Come enliven the spirits of students between the ages of 4 and 12 in our Saturday TechFests! In our TechFests, we introduce to students a STEM topic: Coding an App, Engineering a Circuit, Maker Space topic, or a Science concept. We then teach them the basics of this topic, and then they practice it before making an actual product using the concepts they learned. Your job is to support the instructor (unless you step up to be the instructor, and this has happened on occasion) and to support the students in using the concepts they may be learning for the first time to build a product. You may not be well versed in the STEM concept, but not to worry - there will be some training and orientation beforehand, and we have found that usually it's being there to support the student, along with your own critical thinking and reasoning, you both will be able to figure it out together. We do not introduce extremely complicated STEM concepts (such as Raspberry Pi, Arduino, Java) unless we will have a number of those masters in the room. The STEM concepts we teach are applicable for early learners of STEM, where the barriers to accessing the content is low. We do offer challenging concepts, but they are taught in ways that will reduce stress and frustration, as it's our aim to have the students walking away from the session feeling great about their accomplishments, as well as having learned something new. We also want YOU to have a great experience! The TechFests on the 1st and 2nd Saturdays will be on the campus of Columbia University. These students will be ages 8-12. The time will be 8:30-12:30. The 3rd Saturday TechFest will be at JCC Harlem. These students will be ages 4-8. The time will be 12:45-3:45.
10026.title: Saturday TechFest & Hackathon Volunteers Needed!

10026.description: We are looking for experienced basketball coaches work with our school age and middle school kids. The opportunity would occur during the week late afternoon and evening. Running practice sessions and being at the games would be part of requirement. If interested we can speak further about specific schedules.
10026.title: Youth Basketball Coaches

10026.description: Friends of Nurse-Family Partnership supports the NFP program in the 5 boroughs of NYC. NFP provides nurse home visiting services to low-income first-time mothers. We are searching for someone with expertise in nutrition to either develop short interactive programs or work as an advisor to our current team of volunteers. The information to be developed will be up-to-date and presented in a fun, friendly manner. You can either deliver the programs and/or just be an advisor. Events are held daytimes. You should be available quarterly or more. Please send a RESUME and mention any experience you've had with very young children and pregnant mothers. Also send a PHONE NUMBER.
10026.title: Registered Dietitican to Develop Program for Mothers/Babies
10026.org: FRIENDS OF NEW YORK CITY NURSE FAMILY PARTNERSHIP INC

10026.description: Triple F Empowerment, Inc. inspires, empowers and encourages young people to pursue educational and career goals in the STEAM fields. We need adult volunteers to support our efforts in Harlem, Washington Heights and the Bronx. Volunteers are needed for afternoon classes during the week and/or midday workshops and field trips on Saturdays. We're looking for adults that are interested in giving back to the community by helping our director engage children ages 5-18 in STEAM activities. If you're interested, please send your resume and experience info via email to mssteph@tfempowerment.org.
10026.title: Help us make science fun for children in NYC

10027.description: The High Expectations Department at HEAF is looking for a Youth Leadership Council YLC volunteer instructor to assist students with event planning, completing projects, and participating in organizational efforts to increase community service. The instructor(s) will bring students together to strengthen their leadership skills, relationship-building, and presentation skills. Students will partner up with community organizations to put on either fundraising events and/or service projects. YLC is a student led group, and students will also establish a HEAF centered project. Goals of the Youth Leadership Council: To empower students to participate in their own communities through stewardship. To educate students on keys issues in the community. To give students an opportunity to interact with each other and the community in a positive, constructive way. To provide opportunities to build leadership skills, self-esteem, social skills, and interpersonal relationships. Responsibilities of YLC Instructor: Design and facilitate 90 minute lessons on leadership and service learning Assist students with organizing and implementing community service events Guide students’ intellectual curiosity as they explore issues and challenges facing their community Support students growth into leaders and global citizens Qualifications /Requirements Current college students, college graduates, or graduate students Volunteer should have an interest in community service and youth leadership Volunteer must have experience with group facilitation and event planning Has a personal interest in education and youth development Patient and personable with youth Must be highly motivated
10027.title: Youth Leadership Council Instructor

10027.description: Harlem Educational Activities Fund, Inc. HEAF is seeking dedicated and passionate individuals to serve as academic coaches to provide tutoring and support to our College Quest (High School) students, grades 9-11. Our students need your help in the following subject areas Middle School: English Language Arts (ELA), Math (ratios, percentages, decimals, single variable equations, solving for X, plotting points on a graph) and Social Studies Time Commitment: 2:30 - 4pm, Saturdays High School: English, History (Global, U.S), Math (Trigonometry, Geometry, Algebra), Physics, Biology, Chemistry, Earth Science, Spanish, French Time Commitment: 2:30-4pm, Saturdays About HEAF: The Harlem Educational Activities Fund, Inc. (HEAF) is a comprehensive not-for-profit supplemental education and youth development organization that supports and assists dedicated students to develop the intellectual curiosity, academic ability, social values and personal resiliency they need to ensure success in school, career and life. HEAF identifies scholars in middle school and supports them until they are successfully admitted to four-year colleges through a variety of after-school, Saturday and summer programs. Academic Coach Position Summary: HEAF seeks talented, passionate individuals to work with our high school students to ensure their academic success. HEAF’s College Quest program operates on weekdays from 4:30-6:30pm. Academic Coaches are asked to make at least a one hour/week commitmentfor a minimum of one semester. Academic Coaches provide assistance in core subjects such as Math, English, Science, and Social Studies. Coaches are matched with students based on the coach’s skills in specific subject areas and the student’s needs. Academic Coach Responsibilities: Assess and assist students in at least one of the core subjects Assist students with homework, projects, and test preparation Evaluate and record student progress Attend and participate in scheduled tutor orientation & training meetings Communicate academic progress to program staff Complete and submit required documentation Create a rich learning environment that aids in instructing students with various learning styles General Requirements: Desire to work with and motivate high school students to achieve academic success Some College or B.A. (Masters students in Education encouraged to apply) Advanced skills in Mathematics, English Language Arts, Science, Social Studies, and/or SAT Test Prep Experience tutoring high school students Strong work ethic and professional values Strong interpersonal skills Willingness to promote HEAF educational and youth development philosophy. Ability to work collaboratively with the HEAF staff Ability and willingness to commit to academic year Bilingual (Spanish/English) candidates are highly encouraged to apply. *This position is unpaid
10027.title: Academic Tutor (Brooklyn)

10027.description: Sports Journalism Writer for Asphalt Green’s Community Sports Leagues Newsletter About Asphalt Green Asphalt Green is a not-for-profit organization dedicated to assisting individuals of all ages and backgrounds achieve health through a lifetime of sports and fitness. Our three main community programs reach over 33,000 New Yorkers and include: Waterproofing, which teaches elementary school children how to swim; Recess Enhancement Program, which sends a \"play coach\" to schools to get kids active during recess; and Community Sports League (CSL), which provides Harlem middle school students the chance to play interscholastic organized sports. Job Description As an integral member to the Community Sports League staff, you will be responsible for producing fun, highly detailed and engaging game write ups. You will write out the play by play, interview players, take action shots and choose your game MVP. Your submission will be included in the weekly newsletter and given out to all league participants. Location: Asphalt Green--555 East 90th Street Hours: Soccer, Saturdays 7:00pm - 9:00pm, Basketball Saturdays 10:00am-12:00pm Duration: January 2018 - June 2018 Duties: -Take notes on games every Saturday -Write a recap of each game in the style of a sports reporter. Who were the stars? Was it a close game? Was there a comeback? -Interview players, parents, coaches to add to your piece -Type up your notes and send to our newsletter coordinator by Tuesday morning -Provide general assistance to AG’s CSL staff in maintaining order and a safe, positive environment Qualifications -Excellent writing skills -Must be able to meet deadlines and respond to emails quickly -Must be creative, outgoing and able to speak with kids in a relatable way in order to get fun and full stories -Background in Sports, Communications, or other related discipline is a plus
10027.title: Sports Journalism Writer for Asphalt Green Community Sports Leagues Newsletter

About HEAF: The Harlem Educational Activities Fund, Inc. (HEAF) is a comprehensive not-for-profit supplemental education and youth development organization that supports and assists dedicated students to develop the intellectual curiosity, academic ability, social values and personal resiliency they need to ensure success in school, career and life. As a classroom assistant, you will work alongside one of our teachers to provide supplemental support to our students. Teaching Assistants are asked to make a two hour/week commitment for a minimum of one semester. Teaching Assistants will work alongside our teachers for our Saturday Academic Elective classes. 10027.description: ODYSSEY: The Global MBA Games, dubbed by some as the MBA \"Olympics\" is the premier global competition and conference for business school students from the top MBA programs around the world. We are a non-profit, organization registered in New York that was originally founded in 2009 at Columbia Business School. ODYSSEY is a volunteer organization, in collaboration with numerous leading brands, including Columbia’s Center on Global Brand Leadership, the Luxury Education Foundation, Pernod Ricard and PRME - an initiative of the United Nations Global Compact. Our mission is to support the development of the next generation of leaders. We are currently looking for an EVENT DIRECTOR who will help us to prepare and run the event during March 23-24, 2018 in New York City at the United Nations and Columbia University premises. A competent Event Director will oversee and organize MBA ODYSSEY 2018 and will not leave anything about the event to chance. Your responsibilities will include: Plan event from start to finish per requirements, target audience and objectives Work closely with the Board of Directors regarding details of the event Come up with suggestions to enhance the event’s success Work with tight budget and ensure adherence Source and negotiate with vendors and suppliers Coordinate all operations Lead promotional activities for the event (goodie bags, booklets, banners, certificates, etc.) Supervise all staff (all volunteers, caterers etc.) Approve all aspects before the day of the event Ensure event is completed smoothly and step up to resolve any problems that might occur Although the role is virtual when it comes to preparations and post-event analysis, however there is a need for being on site for both days: March 23 & 24 th, 2018 (two NYC locations, approx. 20 hours total) Some of the requirements that you should possess: Event management experience with excellent organizational skills Outstanding communication and negotiation ability A knack for problem-solving Customer-service orientation A team player with leadership skills Please note this is a volunteering (non-paid) positions that requires approx. 20 hours on site and a few additional hours of preparations weekly for the next two months. We can promise you will gain extra experience in event management, marketing, business development, public relations and create great network of business people. If interested reach out to contact@mbaodyssey.com. Looking forward welcoming you into our team!
10027.title: Event Director

10027.description: The mission of HEAF is to transform the lives of underserved young people, beginning in middle school and continuing in college and beyond, through a youth development approach that includes rigorous year-round academic enrichment, social and cultural exposure, and constant individual attention. Admissions Volunteer Intern Position: The Admissions Intern is a part-time position handling tasks associated with recruiting, screening and admitting students into the HEAF program for our two program sites. Intern will be trained and placed at program headquarters in Manhattan, and report to HEAF’s Manager of Admissions, Community Relations. Intern’s weekly hours range from 10-15 hours per week depending on designated weekly work levels. Program & Administrative Duties Include: Orient, and support prospective students participating in the Admissions process. Help plan Admissions special events (e.g. Open Houses, Appreciation Events, and Special Tours). Collect and maintain student information, including application and other supplemental materials (such as report cards). Prepare written weekly Admissions status reports on received applications, interviewed candidates and accepted students. Design and update Admissions collateral. Use technology (including, but not limited to, email, databases) as means of engaging in communications with prospective families and HEAF staff. Serve as a flexible team member and provide perform other related tasks as deemed necessary by the organization. Qualifications College students in education, social work or related field encouraged to apply. High School diploma and two additional years of volunteer or youth management experience may be considered. Motivated self-starter and team player with strong interpersonal and communication skills, both oral and written, and a positive attitude. Ability to set clear goals and follow through with flexible and creative problem solving. Conceptual ability for the larger perspective with a strong attention to detail and ability to multitask. Working knowledge of computer and internet-based programs for use in communication, data entry and research. (e.g. using Microsoft Software (Word, Excel, and PowerPoint).
10027.title: Data Entry Intern (Admissions)

10027.description: Are you passionate about NYC youth achieving academic success? Are you organized, detail-oriented, and have an interest in learning more about the operations of a successful and comprehensive education and youth development program? Do you have a desire to work with middle and high school aged youth, and make an impact on their educational careers? HEAF is seeking dedicated individuals to serve as education assistants at our HEAF Saturday Academy to provide hands-on support in all areas of program operations. Education Assistants are asked to make a weekly commitment of at least 3 hours on Saturdays for the 2017-18 Academic Year. The weekly work schedule is Saturdays, either from 8:00-11:00 or from 12:00-3:00. Individuals also have the option to volunteer for the entire day (8:00am-3:00pm). HEAF is a comprehensive education and youth development organization that works to help motivated, underserved student develop the intellectual curiosity, academic ability, social values, and personal resiliency they need to ensure success in school, career, and life. HEAF identifies scholars in middle school and supports them until they have successfully graduated from four year colleges through a variety of after-school, Saturday, and summer educational and youth development programs. Responsibilities: Assist Site Coordinator with morning set up: moving supplies from storage, printing class materials, greeting families at front entrance and helping to take attendance Support teachers in ensuring effective classroom management and a positive learning environment Assist and support Teachers in engaging students in activities, discussions, etc. Ensure the safety of students during program transitions and while class is in session Assist Site Coordinator with classroom set up and clean up Assist with entering attendance into the Youth Services Database Maintain responsibility for program supplies and proper use of all facilities Escort and supervise students on offsite activities and field trips Communicate effectively with Program Directors, Site Coordinator and colleagues Perform other duties as needed
10027.title: Saturday Academy Education Assistant (Harlem)

10027.description: We have an amazing elder who wants to continue learning about art and the world. This elder's vision is not what it used to be and is asking for a dedicated volunteer to read to him from his personal library.
10027.title: Reading to an Elder

10027.description: HEAF is looking for a Finance Volunteer to assist the Finance Department. Current Projects Actual vs Budget analysis - Prepare program worksheets, and variance analysis to assist staff with keeping expenses within budgeted limits. Reconcile GL accounts- Prepare detailed schedules to support totals in financial statements i.e payroll liability accounts, fixed assets, prepaid accounts, etc. Reconciliation of contributions and pledges - reconcile $1.4 million gala revenue and other events to clarify total raised, amounts received and amounts still outstanding. Assist with implementation of ADP, web- based Time sheet- transition from manual sign in sheet to keep track of attendance and paid time off. Grant Reporting - prepare budget and compliance reports as requested by donors Assist with monthly closing of general ledger - prepare journal entries, bank reconciliations to assist Director of Finance with meeting monthly reporting deadlines. Required Skills Intermediate knowledge of Microsoft Excel Completed 12 credits in accounting courses or 2 year related work experience. Detailed oriented and looking to grow. Volunteer Benefits Gain & expand new skills. Support HEAF staff in their work. Learn about the internal processes of a non-profit. Receive academic credit if applicable. Expand your professional network. Be part of a lively, dedicated, caring, and passionate team. Location: HEAF’s offices (2090 7 th Avenue, 10 th Floor, New York NY 10027) Supervising Staff: Deirdre Bennett, Director of Finance and Administration Time Commitment: open- office hours M-F 9:00 - 6:30 Other Requirements: U.S Citizen, Permanent Resident
10027.title: Finance Volunteer/Intern

10027.description: Are you a strategic or tactical chess person? If you are either, an elder in West Harlem hoping to play some serious chess! This volunteer should play intermediate to advanced chess. West Harlem Neighbors, a part of Lifeforce in Later Years (LiLY), helps elders with maintaining fulfilling, independent lives. WHN connects elders with friendly visitors, social events, and social services. We know the well being of our community improves when elders, volunteers, and community resources come together in the spirit of friendship. Wouldn't you love to make the world a better place with a warm smile, an engaging conversation, and a continuing friendship with an elder from West Harlem?
10027.title: Chess Player Needed!

10027.description: Volunteer for inventory management and for facility maintenance for both Soup Kitchen and Pantry. Specifically these staff persons will be responsible for (1) receiving, counting and recording stock inventory for pantry, refrigerators and freezers. (2) determining proper storage methods, identifications, and stock locations based on turnover, environmental factors, and physical capabilities of our facility, (3) cleaning and maintaining supplies, tools and equipment in our storage and work areas and ensuring compliance with safety regulations, (4) examining and inspecting stock intems or wear or defects and reporting any damage to supervisors, (5) gathering all discarded boxes and garbage to be taken to designated area for disposal, and (6) setting up and breaking down 15 tables to be utlilized for Client Choose set-up and folding chairs.
10027.title: Deliveries and Stocking

10027.description: Located in Harlem on 132nd Street, Cecil Ivory House is a 24 bed transitional housing program targeting formerly homeless clients who are either mentally ill or dually diagnosed as mentally ill and chemically addicted. The mission of this program is to provide a safe and supportive environment where residents take part in rehabilitation interventions that will assist them in the attainment of their work, social and community living goals. A variety of services are available, including case management, substance abuse groups, medication monitoring, daily skills training and recreational activities. Now is your chance to step up and help us in our goals! Do you enjoy socializing, running game nights, showing movies or turning the stereo up a bit for a little dancing? Are you able to introduce yourself, share a few jokes, spread some smiles and host a small party? If so, the residents of Cecil Ivory would love to have you host a small Friday Night Social. We’ll provide the games, snacks and music; you just need to bring the smiles and good times! We are looking to start this up at 6:30pm and make it a bi-weekly event. So put on your party shirt and give me a call! PLEASE NOTE: In order to insure the integrity of the BRC volunteer program, as well as the well being of the clients we service, all interested parties must complete a New Volunteer Registration form and attend an orientation, prior to receiving an assignment. Apologies, but we are unable to accept walk-ins.
10027.title: Calling All Party Planners and Hosts!

10027.description: Located in Harlem on 132nd Street, Cecil Ivory House is a 24 bed transitional housing program targeting formerly homeless clients who are either mentally ill or dually diagnosed as mentally ill and chemically addicted. The mission of this program is to provide a safe and supportive environment where residents take part in rehabilitation interventions that will assist them in the attainment of their work, social and community living goals. A variety of services are available, including case management, substance abuse groups, medication monitoring, daily skills training and recreational activities. Now is your chance to step up and help us in our goals! We currently operate a weekly soap making class at BRC Cecil Ivory House and our clients truly have a great time. It’s not just an opportunity to learn a new hobby, it’s also a great way to create a sense of community in a social setting. No need to have any previous experience. If you have the enthusiasm and willingness to learn, and are available on Tuesdays from 4pm to 5pm, we will be happy to teach you everything you need to know. Learn a new craft, have a little fun and do some good! PLEASE NOTE: In order to insure the integrity of the BRC volunteer program, as well as the well being of the clients we service, all interested parties must complete a New Volunteer Registration form and attend an orientation, prior to receiving an assignment. Apologies, but we are unable to accept walk-ins.
10027.title: Get Squeaky Clean with Homemade Soap!  Host a Soap Making Class!

10027.description: Located in Harlem on 132nd Street, Cecil Ivory House is a 24 bed transitional housing program targeting formerly homeless clients who are either mentally ill or dually diagnosed as mentally ill and chemically addicted. The mission of this program is to provide a safe and supportive environment where residents take part in rehabilitation interventions that will assist them in the attainment of their work, social and community living goals. A variety of services are available, including case management, substance abuse groups, medication monitoring, daily skills training and recreational activities. Now is your chance to step up and help us in our goals! If you love fiction and writing, particularly short stories or poems, we could truly benefit from your passion. We all know putting pen to paper through the written word is an excellent means to express oneself, and our residents are no different. Like you, they have stories to reveal, and with your help, we can help them tell them. We hope to introduce this informal, one hour writing group on Saturdays, any time between the hours of 11am and 6pm. If you would care to take the reins on this activity, give me a call. PLEASE NOTE: In order to insure the integrity of the BRC volunteer program, as well as the well being of the clients we service, all interested parties must complete a New Volunteer Registration form and attend an orientation, prior to receiving an assignment. Apologies, but we are unable to accept walk-ins.
10027.title: Have a Love for the Written Word?

10027.description: CALLING ALL MARKETING & ADVERTISING EXPERTS! Do you want to use your expertise to help underserved entrepreneurs build and sustain their thriving businesses? Our Market Access Program pairs entrepreneurs with pro bono marketing and advertising experts like you for project-based mentoring opportunities that address key Marketing challenges including: - Developing a strategic plan to improve business exposure over next three years. - Outlining appropriate social media channels, including goals and metrics for success. - Formalizing an online marketing plan with measurable goals for improving visibility and generating new customers. - Reviewing current branding strategy and its implementation. - Receiving detailed feedback on current website’s layout, user functionality, visual design, and content. - Thinking through a plan for maximizing business sales and outlining measurable goals. - Developing SEM plan with goals and strategy for improving website ranking. Please visit us at www.startsmallthinkbig.org to learn more about our organization and to see some of the businesses we serve. If you are interested in this opportunity and would like more information, please submit a volunteer interest form at bit.ly/startsmallthinkbig or book a 30 minute introductory call at bit.ly/sstbvolunteer. If you have any questions, please do not hesitate to email Mabell Fernandez, Market Access Program Director at mabell@startsmallthinkbig.org We look forward to working with you!

Our Market Access Program pairs entrepreneurs with pro bono marketing and advertising experts like you for project-based mentoring opportunities that address key Marketing challenges including: - Developing a strategic plan to improve business exposure over next three years. - Outlining appropriate social media channels, including goals and metrics for success. - Formalizing an online marketing plan with measurable goals for improving visibility and generating new customers. - Reviewing current branding strategy and its implementation. - Receiving detailed feedback on current website’s layout, user functionality, visual design, and content. - Thinking through a plan for maximizing business sales and outlining measurable goals. - Developing SEM plan with goals and strategy for improving website ranking. Please visit us at www.startsmallthinkbig.org to learn more about our organization and to see some of the businesses we serve. If you are interested in this opportunity and would like more information, please submit a volunteer interest form at bit.ly/startsmallthinkbig or book a 30 minute introductory call at bit.ly/sstbvolunteer. If you have any questions, please do not hesitate to email Mabell Fernandez, Market Access Program Director at mabell@startsmallthinkbig.org We look forward to working with you!
10027.title: Online Advertising Expert for Small Business
